keyTakeAways: Former New York prison guard Robert Brooks was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, and died from severe internal injuries.
A jury found David Kingsley guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.
The body-camera footage, though silent, showed guards assaulting Brooks in a gang-like manner, with no apparent concern, and was central to the prosecution’s case.
The New York State Attorney General Letitia James recused herself from the case, leading to William Fitzpatrick becoming the special prosecutor.
William Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards in the March 1, 2025, beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility.
Six of the ten guards indicted were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Three guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at trial.
Defense attorneys argued that the defendants should not be held responsible for the acts of other guards and that their individual actions did not meet the standard for murder.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the beating death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was attacked three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage showing guards assaulting Brooks without concern, prompted widespread public outrage and led to a jury conviction. Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with involvement in the assault. The case is part of a broader investigation into systemic violence in state prisons, with the Onondaga County District Attorney William Fitzpatrick leading the prosecution after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself. Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards in the separate killing of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. Six of the ten guards indicted have been charged with murder or manslaughter, with several pleading guilty or agreeing to reduced charges, highlighting ongoing accountability efforts.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, Two Others Acquitted
